LanguageData.StatsReport_MeleeDPSExplanation: DPS = Melee damage * Melee hit chance / Cooldown in seconds
LanguageData.StatsReport_GraveCorpseRelatedAbstract: Meditator is related to the corpse inside
LanguageData.Stat_RecreationType_Desc: Different sources of recreation satisfy different recreation types. Colonists become bored of doing the same recreation type repeatedly, so it is important to provide a variety of recreation sources with different recreation types.
LanguageData.Stat_MineableThing_Desc: The item that will be yielded when mining this.
LanguageData.Stat_MiningYield_Desc: The maximum amount of items yielded when mining this. The actual yield will be adjusted by the mining skill of the miner.
LanguageData.Stat_SourceSpecies_Desc: The species of creature from which this was taken.
LanguageData.Stat_Stuff_Desc: The stuff this thing is made of. This affects many other stats, including weapon damage, apparel armor and insulation, item and building hit points, beauty, market value, and much more.
LanguageData.Stat_Weapon_Desc: The weapon used by this turret.
LanguageData.Stat_HitPoints_Desc: How much damage an object can take before being destroyed.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_WorkToUninstall_Desc: The amount of work it takes to uninstall this.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_CreatedAt_Desc: Which facilities can be used to produce this.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Damage_Desc: The amount of damage this weapon deals.\n\nThis may be deflected or mitigated by the target's armor.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_MedicineXpGainFactor_Des: A multiplier on the amount of experience doctors gain when using this to tend a patient.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Apparel_Covers_Desc: Which body parts this covers.\n\nArmor does not protect body parts that it does not cover.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Apparel_Layer_Desc: Which apparel layers this fills.\n\nFor a given body part, only one piece of apparel can be worn in each layer.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Plant_FertilityRequirement_De: The minimum soil fertility that this plant requires to grow.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Plant_FertilitySensitivity_De: How sensitive this plant is to soil fertility.\n\nLow sensitivity means the plant will grow about the same speed in rich or poor soil. High sensitivity means the plant grows slow in poor soil, but faster in rich soil.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Plant_LightRequirement_Desc: The amount of light this plant requires to grow.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Plant_LifeSpan_Desc: The lifespan of the plant.\n\nPlants naturally die after they reach a certain age, even if not harvested.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Plant_HarvestYield_Desc: The amount of product this plant will yield when harvested.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Plant_MinGrowthTemperature_De: The minimum temperature this plant can survive.\n\nTemperatures below this will cause damage over time.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Plant_MaxGrowthTemperature_De: The maximum temperature this plant can survive.\n\nTemperatures above this will cause damage over time.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Plant_MinGrowingSkillToSow_De: The minimum skill needed for a farmer to to sow this plant.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_Diet_Desc: The kinds of food this creature is capable of eating.\n\nCan eat: {0}
LanguageData.Stat_Race_LeatherType_Desc: The type of leather this creature will yield when butchered.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_Animal_TameFailedRevengeChance: The chance that this creature will attack when a tamer tries to tame it and fails.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_Trainability_Desc: This creature's general mental aptitude for training. This is a combination of intelligence and attentiveness. It determines which kinds of tasks this creature can be trained to perform.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_LifeExpectancy_Desc: The average life expectancy of this creature.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Ingestible_Joy_Desc: The recreational value of ingesting this. Higher numbers will fulfill the recreation need more.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_BodySize_Desc: The size of this creature's body, compared to an average adult human.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Weapon_MeleeWarmupTime_Desc: How much time passes between when a melee attack with this weapon begins and when it hits.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Weapon_BurstShotCount_Desc: The amount of shots this weapon fires in each burst.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Weapon_BurstShotFireRate_Desc: The fire rate of this weapon during each burst.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Weapon_Range_Desc: The maximum range of this weapon.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Weapon_MissRadius_Desc: The radius of random spread on shots fired by this weapon.\n\nHigh values make projectiles disperse randomly around the target.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Weapon_DirectHitChance_Desc: The chance that a shot will directly hit its target if not intercepted, dodged or stopped.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_MoodChange_Desc: This body part's effect on the mood of the owner.
LanguageData.Stat_Recipe_Skill_Desc: The main skill used while performing this recipe.\n\nIt determines the quality of the result, and is learned while performing this recipe.
LanguageData.Stat_Recipe_Ingredients_Desc: The ingredients required to perform this recipe.
LanguageData.Stat_Recipe_SkillRequirements_Desc: The skills required to perform this recipe.
LanguageData.Stat_Recipe_Products_Desc: The products produced by this recipe.
LanguageData.Stat_Recipe_WorkSpeedStat_Desc: Which character stat governs the workspeed of this recipe.\n\nThe higher the stat of the worker is, the faster work will be done.
LanguageData.Stat_Recipe_EfficiencyStat_Desc: Which stat governs the quality or amount of output.\n\nThe higher the stat of the worker is, the higher the quality or yield will be.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Surgery_SuccessChanceFactor_D: A multiplier on the chance this operation will be a success. More difficult operations have lower multipliers.\n\nThe actual chance of success of a surgery is also affected by the doctor, facilities, and medicine used.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Surgery_SuccessChanceFactor_C: Performing this operation is safe for the patient.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Surgery_DeathOnFailChance_Des: The chance the patient will die upon failure of this surgery.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_TotalBleedFactor_Desc: A multiplier applied to the overall rate of blood loss.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_NaturalHealingFactor_Desc: A multiplier applied to the overall rate of natural wound healing.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_FoodPoisoningChanceFactor_De: A multiplier applied to the chance of getting food poisoning.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_BleedingRate_Desc: The rate at which this condition causes blood loss.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_Pain_Desc: The amount of pain caused by this condition.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_PartEfficiency_Desc: The offset in efficiency applied to body parts affected by this.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_HungerRateFactor_Desc: A multiplier on the rate at which the food need depletes.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_HungerRateOffset_Desc: An offset on the rate at which the food need depletes.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_TirednessOffset_Desc: An offset applied to the rate at which the creatures rest need falls.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_TirednessFactor_Desc: A multiplier applied to the rate at which the creatures rest need falls.
LanguageData.Stat_Hediff_PreventsInfection_Desc: Whether or not this will prevent infections.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_TerrainRequirement_Desc: This can only be placed on terrain of these types.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Terrain_Fine_Desc: This floor is considered fine and suitable for royalty.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_PowerConsumption_Desc: The amount of power this building will draw from the power grid.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_ReloadChargesRemaining_Desc: The number of {CHARGENOUN_plural} remaining on this object. If these run out, the special ability can no longer be used.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_ReloadMaxCharges_Desc: The maximum number of {CHARGENOUN_plural} this object has.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_ReloadRefill_Desc: The amount of items required to fully reload this object.\n\nThis object can be reloaded before it is empty, but the cost is the same as if it was empty.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_ReloadPerCharge_Desc: The amount of items required to reload one {CHARGENOUN}. Multiple {CHARGENOUN_plural} can be reloaded at once.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_ReloadDestroyOnEmpty_Desc: This item will vanish when its last {CHARGENOUN} is used.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_BodyPartEfficiency_Desc: The overall efficiency of this body part.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Biocoded_Desc: This item has been coded to only accept a particular individual's bio-signature.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_Chemical_Desc: The active chemical in this.\n\nIn some cases, the same chemical is present in multiple different drugs. These different drugs will satisfy the same addiction in different ways.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_HighGainPerDose_Desc: The intensity of high gained per dose of this drug.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_HighFallPerDay_Desc: How much this drug's high will decay each day.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_HighDurationPerDose_Desc: How long this drug's high will last per dose.\n\nThis is calculated from the high gained per dose and the high fall rate.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_ToleranceGainPerDose_Des: How much a user's tolerance to the chemical will increase for each dose of this drug.\n\nThis can be different for different forms of the same chemical.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_ToleranceFallPerDay_Desc: How much a user's tolerance to the chemical will fall per day.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_MinToleranceForAddiction: The minimum tolerance required to become newly addicted to this drug.\n\nIf a user is below this tolerance level, they can't become newly addicted from taking a dose.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_SafeDoseInterval_Desc:
A user will never become addicted if they never take the drug more often than this.

This is calculated from the drug's minimum tolerance to addict, the tolerance gain per dose, and the rate of tolerance decay.

Note that some drugs don't have a safe interval. Such drugs can addict on any dose, even the first one.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_RandomODChance_Desc: The chance of a random overdose when taking this drug. Random overdoses can happen on any dose, whether it's a new user's first try or an experienced addict's hundredth hit.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_Addictiveness_Desc: The chance of addiction per dose of this drug.\n\nIf the drug has a minimum tolerance to addict, the tolerance must be above that level for this to apply. If there is no minimum tolerance, any dose can cause an addiction.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_AddictionSeverityInitial: New addictions caused by this drug begin at this severity level.\n\nTaking more of the drug will increase addiction severity, while time will reduce it.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_AddictionRecoveryTime_De: How long it takes to recover from an initial addiction to this drug.\n\nThis is be calculated from the new addiction severity divided by the rate of addiction recovery. An addiction which has been fed will take longer.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_AddictionSeverityPerDose: How much severity is added to an existing addiction for each dose of this drug.\n\nAddiction severity cannot go above 100%.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_AddictionNeedDoseInterva: How often an addict needs to take a dose of this drug to feed the addiction and prevent withdrawal.\n\nThis is calculated from the addiction need fall rate and the need fill per dose.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_AddictionNeedOffset_Desc: How much each dose of this drug fills an addict's need for the chemical.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_AddictionNeedFallRate_De: How quickly an addict's need for the chemical will fall.
LanguageData.Stat_Thing_Drug_AddictionCost_Desc:
The market value of drugs that must be consumed per day to support an addiction to this drug without going into withdrawal.

This value is calculated from the addict's chemical need per dose, the need fall rate, and the market value of this drug.

Note that there may be other ways to get the same chemical with different costs.
